intro: Saussurea yiwuensis, commonly known as the Yiwu Saussurea, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Yiwu region in Zhejiang Province. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its inflorescence consists of a central yellow disk surrounded by ray florets, which are often pale yellow to white in color. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
